snippet: The front-runner in Afghanistan’s presidential election, Mr. Abdullah has pushed ahead by excelling at the central skill of Afghan political leadership: making deals.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Abdullah Abdullah, former Afghan foreign minister and frontrunner in country's presidential election; Abdullah, whose mixed ethnicity of Pashtun and Tajik has been seized on by critics, faces runoff election against his closest competitor Ashraf Ghani, and has received endorsements of every significant presidential candidate from first round, all of them Pashtuns.
lead_paragraph: The front-runner in Afghanistan’s presidential election, Mr. Abdullah has pushed ahead by excelling at the central skill of Afghan political leadership: making deals.

headline.main: Abdullah Abdullah Moves Toward Center of Afghan Power
headline.print_headline: An Afghan Who Never Strayed Far Closes In on Center of Power
